solution_line_template: The first bakery needs {first_bakery_weekly_needs} x {num_weeks} = <<{first_bakery_weekly_needs}*{num_weeks}={first_bakery_total_sacks}>>{first_bakery_total_sacks} sacks of strawberries per month.

The second bakery needs {second_bakery_weekly_needs} x {num_weeks} = <<{second_bakery_weekly_needs}*{num_weeks}={second_bakery_total_sacks}>>{second_bakery_total_sacks} sacks of strawberries per month.
The third bakery needs {third_bakery_weekly_needs} x {num_weeks} = <<{third_bakery_weekly_needs}*{num_weeks}={third_bakery_total_sacks}>>{third_bakery_total_sacks} sacks of strawberries per month.

Therefore, Antoine needs {third_bakery_total_sacks} + {second_bakery_total_sacks} + {first_bakery_total_sacks} = <<{third_bakery_total_sacks}+{second_bakery_total_sacks}+{first_bakery_total_sacks}={total_sacks_all_bakeries}>>{total_sacks_all_bakeries} sacks of strawberries to supply all the bakeries for a month.
